introPage.introduction: Check your familiarity with various popular digital-literacy related terms with our short "pop quiz".

params.taskDescription: Drag the words into the correct boxes
params.resetDropDescription: Are you sure you want to reset this drop zone?
params.a11yCheck: Check the answers. The responses will be marked as correct, incorrect, or unanswered.
params.a11yShowSolution: Show the solution. The task will be marked with its correct solution.
params.a11yRetry: Retry the task. Reset all responses and start the task over again.
params.textField: witter and Facebook are examples of *social networking* sites. Sadly sometimes people deliberately post unpleasant and cruel comments to attack a particular person and this is known as *trolling*. Another negative aspect of these online environments is when someone constantly follows another person around online, private messaging them, commenting on their posts and provoking discomfort. This is known as *cyber stalking* and is in fact a crime.

params.question: The responsible use of technology by anyone who uses computers, the internet, and digital devices to engage with society on any level is know as......?

behaviour.feedbackOnCorrect: While some younger people might be better at tech than some older people, it is not always the case! And there is no inborn understanding of digital technology.
behaviour.feedbackOnWrong: While some younger people might be better at tech than some older people, it is not always the case! And there is no inborn understanding of digital technology.

params.question: Digital natives (young people born into the digital age) are more digitally literate than so-called digital immigrants (people born before the internet and who had to learn how to use computers etc). This is because digital natives have better skills and are more comfortable with all types of technology.
